TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed StringType extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This class has been deprecated as of Visual Basic 2005.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class provides methods for manipulating data that potentially represents a `String` value.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void MidStmtStr (ref string sDest, int StartPosition, int MaxInsertLength, string sInsert);
.method public static void MidStmtStr(string sDest, int32 StartPosition, int32 MaxInsertLength, string sInsert) cil managed

Docs.param: Required. String variable to modify.
Required. Location in the sDest parameter to begin overwriting from. The index is 1-based.
Required. Maximum number of characters from the sInsert parameter to use, starting from the first character.
Required. String value to overwrite the sDest parameter with.
Docs.summary: Overwrites the parameter with the contents of the parameter.

Required. String to compare with sLeft.

Docs.summary: Compares two strings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class supports the Visual Basic compiler and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool StrLike (string Source, string Pattern, Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompareMethod CompareOption);
.method public static bool StrLike(string Source, string Pattern, valuetype Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompareMethod CompareOption) cil managed

Docs.param: Required. Any expression.
Any expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.
Specifies how to compare strings to patterns, according to the . Can be for binary comparison or for comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's value.
Docs.summary: Compares the parameters and and returns the same results as the operator.
Docs.returns: A value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is . If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is . If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method compares the parameters `Source` and `Pattern` and returns the same results as the [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md). The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool StrLikeBinary (string Source, string Pattern);
.method public static bool StrLikeBinary(string Source, string Pattern) cil managed

Docs.param: Required. Any expression.
Required. Any expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.
Docs.summary: Compares the parameters and and returns the same results as the operator, using binary comparison.
Docs.returns: A value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is . If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is . If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method compares the parameters `Source` and `Pattern` and returns the same results as the [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md). The result is a Boolean value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.
This method is similar to <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.StringType.StrLike%2A> except that it always performs a case-sensitive binary comparison.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool StrLikeText (string Source, string Pattern);
.method public static bool StrLikeText(string Source, string Pattern) cil managed

Docs.param: Required. Any expression.
Required. Any expression conforming to the pattern-matching conventions described in Like Operator.
Docs.summary: Compares the parameters and and returns the same results as the operator, using text comparison.
Docs.returns: A value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern. If the value in string satisfies the pattern contained in pattern, result is . If the string does not satisfy the pattern, result is . If both string and pattern are empty strings, the result is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method compares the parameters `Source` and `Pattern` and returns the same results as the [Like Operator](~/docs/visual-basic/language-reference/operators/like-operator.md). The result is a `Boolean` value indicating whether or not the string satisfies the pattern.
This method is similar to <xref:Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.StringType.StrLike%2A> except that it always performs a comparison based on a case-insensitive text sort order determined by your system's `LocaleID` value.
